page.title: 10BRADSHAWS TRANSPORT
page.content: Bradshaws was founded in 1885 by John Bradshaw of Sturton by Stow.At first they all were Agricultural contractors and used to hire out,machines to help farmers.During the 2nd World War Bradshaws helped to build some of the local R.A.F.aerodromes.In 1948 the government nationalised all the large transport companies.Bradshaws was too small to be included.The small compan y was based at Sturton-by-Stow.Later as it grew they built a depot in Gainsborough.Then they took over a firm called Wiles Transport on Church St.In 1961 they built a new depot in Willoughby st.They carry all sorts of goods ranging from oil to grain and general haulage.There are about 50 lorries and 60 people at Bradshaws.
